Tweaks that make police more capable at finding ships using cover and stops reputation loss for attacking police factions enemies in their sectors.
Ships will notify you at a higher HP if they are under attack and the notification isn't disabled.
Improves the ability for factions to gather ships to defend their space or objectives.
Improves the ability for factions to gather ships to invade sectors
Enables drones to use travel drives more reliably if they have the ability to activate travel drive.
Increases repair limit to 100% regardless of skill. Does not increase repair rate.
Allows pilots to use flairs when under attack from missiles without skill penalty.
Miners gain bonus mining speed from resource probe in sector instead of requiring them to be close.
Allow Player Ships to Use Boost
Prevents player owned ships from using boost when fleeing, evading, or moving through gate. Now includes most instances of boost usage.

Ships that execute move.flee.boost are less likely to fly towards enemies; civilian ships are less likely to attack instead of flee; fleeing S/M are less picky about how close a station is to dock at.
Ships are less likely to slowboat across the galaxy.
Patrol ships are more likely to respond to ships in distress anywhere in the sector. Recon ships are smarter and actually report threats.
Mining ships unable to sell cargo will dump it to continue earning mining experience. Advanced/Expert will always check for demand prior to mining.
Vanilla trade script decreases on idle time and more likely to check additional offers.
Increases the distance weighting when AI decides where to order a job ship.
Improved targeting script to have ships prefer targets in range and of similar class. Ships using applicable torpedos will prefer larger targets.
Capital ships attacking a station will now rotate around a station clockwise in 15 degree increments when they do not have line of sight on their active target. Primarily fixes station debris issues.
